page:
La tipología - Clases de sustantivo y clasificadores Algunas lenguas tienen un sistema de clases de sustantivo que indican su forma, posición u otras características. En muchas de estas lenguas, el indicador de clase es un tipo de concordancia que es requerido entre todos los modificadores en la frase nominal y también con el verbo. Por eso, los cuantificadores, artículos, demostrativos, adjetivos y verbos posiblemente necesitan ser marcados con un indicador de clase appropriado.
Las lenguas Bantu que se habla en África tienen el sistema de clases de sustantivo más conocido en el mundo. Estas lenguas poseen hasta 22 clases distintas, que son representadas con los números. Aproximadamente la mitad son para los sustantivos singulares solamente y un número igual para los sustantivos plurales solamente. Otros están para los sustantivos no contables o abstractos o para los lugares. Tenemos aquí algunos ejemplos de Sesotho, una lengua Bantu que se habla mayormente en el sur de África, (1) mostrando la concordancia de los indicadores de clase en las frases nominales de ambos el sujeto y objeto y (2) mostrando el uso de los indicadores de clasie en el verbo para ambos el sujeto y objeto cuando son pronombres. (Datos de Demuth, K. 2000. Bantu noun class systems: Loan word and acquistion evidence of semantic productivity. En G. Senft (ed.), Classification Systems. Cambridge University Press: 270-292.)
1. Ba-shányanabá-nebá-fúmánédi-perekisitsé-moná
2-muchachos2-DEM2SBJ-encontraron10-melocotones10-bueno
‘Those boys found some tasty peaches.' (Esos muchachos encontraron algunos melocotones sabrosos.)
2.Bá-di-fúmáné
2SBJ-10OBJ-encontraron
‘They found them.' (Los encontraron.)
En cambio, unas lenguas pueden tener un sistema de clasificadores, a veces llamado palabras de contador o palabras de medida. Estos clasificadores son palabras o morfemas que acompañan a los sustantivos cuando el sustantivo es contado o especificado y sirven para clasificar el sustantivo dependiendo del tipo de su referente. Algunas lenguas tienen varios cientos clasificadores. El clasificador se relaciona con el sustantivo contado o especificado, pero no hay otra concordancia dentro de la frase nominal u oración.
Los clasificadores son una característica importante de muchas lenguas del este asiático. Ejemplos de chino mandarín (forma pinyin) ilustran el uso de los clasificadores con un numeral (3-6) y un demostrativo (7). (Los ejemplos son de Wikipedia).
3.sāngèxuéshēng
tresclasificador.humanoestudiante
‘tres estudiantes’
4.sānkēshù
tresclasificador.árbolárbol
‘tres árboles’
5.sānzhīniǎo
tresclasificador.aveave
‘tres aves’
6.sāntiáohé
tresclasificador.largo.onduladorío
‘tres ríos’
7.zhègèrén
estoclasificador.humanopersona
‘esta persona’
Un sistema de clasificadores más simple es illustrado en los ejemplos (3-5) del mixteco de Ayutla, que se habla en el sur de México. En esta lengua, se encuentran prefijos clasificadores que son derivados de un sustantivo genérico o de un pronombre y estos deben aparecer con muchos de los sustantivos que refieren a animales, insectos, líquidos, árboles, objetos de madera u objetos que son básicamente redondos. En mixteco, no existe concordancia de clasificador en la frase nominal ni en la oración, entonces estos prefijos solamente marcan los sustantivos y tal vez son más derivacionales. Sin embargo, existen distincciones similares en los pronombres de la tercera persona que refieren a estos sustantivos. El mixteco utiliza nombres en vez de números para identificar los clasificadores. Algunas de las raíces del sustantivo son claramente una palabra, pero otros son elementos indeterminables. (Datos de Hills, Robert. 1990. A Syntactic Sketch of Ayutla Mixtec. En Bradley, C. Henry and Barbara E. Hollenbach, (eds.) Studies in the Syntax of Mixtecan Languages. Vol.2. The Summer Institute of Linguistics and The University of Texas at Arlington:Dallas. 200-201.)
3. si-ndīkih
ANIMAL-cuerno
‘cow, cattle' (vaca, ganado)
4.tē-hnīh
LIQUIDO-caliente
‘liquor' (licor)
5.tun-tāhnūh
MADERA-está.volando
‘airplane' (avión)
RTypologyClassifier ¿Existe en su lengua algún sistema de clase de sustantivo o clasificador ilustrado arriba? No Sí, con la concordancia en varios elementos como el sistema de bantu arriba Sí, los clasificadores se presentan con sustantivos cuando son contados o especificados como el sistema de chino arriba, pero no existe otra concordancia Sí, las clases de sustantivos son distinguidos como el sistema de mixteco arriba, pero no existe concordancia
RTypologyClassifierNumber ¿Los indicadores de clase son distinguidos por números o por los clases? Por números de clases Por los nombres de clases
Ahora se le pedirá información acerca de cada indicador de claseclasificador para producir una tabla en la gramática. Complete por favor todos los campos relevantes y haga clic en la accidente gramatical de número apropiado para cada clase. Si se utiliza más de una forma del morfema para una claseclasificador particular, escriba por favor cada uno y agregue por favor un guión a cada forma para indicar si es un prefijo o un sufijo. Estamos asumiendo que los números utilizados comienzan con uno. Si no, se necesita cambiarlos cuando corrija la gramática. Si usted no tiene tantas clases como los solicitados aquí, simplemente deje los campos vacíos.
Escriba las formas para la clase 1 aquí: 1

RTypologyClassifierAgrTypeNumAgr ¿Existen clasificadores separados para cada clase en su lengua basado en la concordancia de número? No, existe solamente un clasificador para cada clase de sustantivo Sí, existen clasificadores separados para singular y plural para cada clase de sustantivo
Escriba las formas de la clase para animal singular aquí: animal Escriba las formas de la clase para animal plural aquí: animal Escriba las formas de la clase para insecto singular aquí: insecto Escriba las formas de la clase para insecto plural aquí: insecto Escriba las formas de la clase para líquido singular aquí: líquido Escriba las formas de la clase para líquido plural aquí: líquido Escriba las formas de la clase para redondo singular aquí: redondo Escriba las formas de la clase para redondo plural aquí: redondo Escriba las formas de la clase para cilíndrico singular aquí: cilíndrico Escriba las formas de la clase para cilíndrico plural aquí: cilíndrico Escriba las formas de la clase para esférico singular aquí: esférico Escriba las formas de la clase para esférico plural aquí: esférico Escriba las formas de la clase para árbol singular aquí: árbol Escriba las formas de la clase para árbol plural aquí: árbol Escriba las formas de la clase para madera singular aquí: madera Escriba las formas de la clase para madera plural aquí: madera Escriba las formas de la clase para inanimado general u otro singular aquí:

In the lexicon, enter the feature singular on all the singular class markers and the feature plural on all the plural class markers. Do not enter a number feature on any class markers which can go with either singular or plural or mass nouns. Also enter a feature of the form class_##, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25, on each class marker that goes on nouns or other modifiers in the nominal phrase as appropriate.
For the same or other class markers that go on verbs, add the following features as appropriate:
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_##_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class__##_object, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25 as instructed above.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_##_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class__##_object, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25 as instructed above.
For the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features singular_ergative or plural_ergative, along with class_##_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features singular_absolutive or plural_absolutive, along with class_##_absolutive, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25 as instructed above.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_##_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class__##_object, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25 as instructed above.
Within the split case system, for the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features singular_ergative or plural_ergative, along with class_##_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features singular_absolutive or plural_absolutive, along with class_##_absolutive, replacing the ## with a number between 1 and 25 as instructed above.
In the lexicon, enter the feature singular on all the singular class markers and the feature plural on all the plural class markers. Also enter one of the features class_animal, class_insect, class_liquid, class_round, class_cylindrical, class_spherical, class_tree, class_wood or class_other on each class marker that goes on nouns or other modifiers in the nominal phrase as appropriate.
For the same or other class markers that go on verbs, add the following features as appropriate:
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
For the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features singular_ergative or plural_ergative, along with class_animal_ergative, class_insect_ergative, class_liquid_ergative, class_round_ergative, class_cylindrical_ergative, class_spherical_ergative, class_tree_ergative, class_wood_ergative or class_other_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features singular_absolutive or plural_absolutive, along with class_animal_absolutive, class_insect_absolutive, class_liquid_absolutive, class_round_absolutive, class_cylindrical_absolutive, class_spherical_absolutive, class_tree_absolutive, class_wood_absolutive or class_other_absolutive.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features singular_subject or plural_subject, along with class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features singular_object or plural_object, along with class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
Within the split case system, for the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features singular_ergative or plural_ergative, along with class_animal_ergative, class_insect_ergative, class_liquid_ergative, class_round_ergative, class_cylindrical_ergative, class_spherical_ergative, class_tree_ergative, class_wood_ergative or class_other_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features singular_absolutive or plural_absolutive, along with class_animal_absolutive, class_insect_absolutive, class_liquid_absolutive, class_round_absolutive, class_cylindrical_absolutive, class_spherical_absolutive, class_tree_absolutive, class_wood_absolutive or class_other_absolutive.
In the lexicon, enter one of the features class_animal, class_insect, class_liquid, class_round, class_cylindrical, class_spherical, class_tree, class_wood or class_other on each class marker that goes on nouns or other modifiers in the nominal phrase as appropriate.
For the same or other class markers that go on verbs, add the following features as appropriate:
For the class markers for subjects, use the features class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features along with class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
For the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features class_animal_ergative, class_insect_ergative, class_liquid_ergative, class_round_ergative, class_cylindrical_ergative, class_spherical_ergative, class_tree_ergative, class_wood_ergative or class_other_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features class_animal_absolutive, class_insect_absolutive, class_liquid_absolutive, class_round_absolutive, class_cylindrical_absolutive, class_spherical_absolutive, class_tree_absolutive, class_wood_absolutive or class_other_absolutive.
For the class markers for subjects, use the features class_animal_subject, class_insect_subject, class_liquid_subject, class_round_subject, class_cylindrical_subject, class_spherical_subject, class_tree_subject, class_wood_subject or class_other_subject.
For the class markers for objects, use the features class_animal_object, class_insect_object, class_liquid_object, class_round_object, class_cylindrical_object, class_spherical_object, class_tree_object, class_wood_object or class_other_object.
Within the split case system, for the class markers for ergative arguments, use the features class_animal_ergative, class_insect_ergative, class_liquid_ergative, class_round_ergative, class_cylindrical_ergative, class_spherical_ergative, class_tree_ergative, class_wood_ergative or class_other_ergative.
For the class markers for absolutive arguments, use the features class_animal_absolutive, class_insect_absolutive, class_liquid_absolutive, class_round_absolutive, class_cylindrical_absolutive, class_spherical_absolutive, class_tree_absolutive, class_wood_absolutive or class_other_absolutive.
In the lexicon, enter one of the features class_animal, class_insect, class_liquid, class_round, class_cylindrical, class_spherical, class_tree, class_wood or class_other on each classifier as appropriate. In the lexicon, if these classifiers do not have the category Class, then add the feature makeClass to the lexical entry to change the category for the syntax. Also add one of the features class_human, class_animal, class_bird, class_boat, class_clothing, class_tree, class_thin, class_wavy, class_flat, class_cylindrical, class_mechanical, class_generic or class_other on each classifier as appropriate.
&TechnicalTerms;
